title: Fourier–Mukai transform
summary: In algebraic geometry, a Fourier–Mukai transform ΦK  is a functor between derived categories of coherent sheaves D(X) → D(Y) for schemes X and Y, which is, in a sense, an integral transform along a kernel object K ∈ D(X×Y). Most natural functors, including basic ones like pushforwards and pullbacks, are of this type.
